alert.note: Alert for Benton; Marshall; Tippah; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:53PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Union, eastern Marshall, southwestern Tippah and southern Benton Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 352 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Bethlehem, or 13 miles east of Wall Doxey State Park, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Albany, Blue Mountain, Keownville, Etta, Hickory Flat, Potts Camp, Myrtle, Cotton Plant, Shari, Winborn, Poolville, Martintown, Concord, Old Myrtle, Pumpkin Center, Molino, Baker, Pine Grove, Cornersville and Bethel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Mississippi.
